sources.title: Far from Vietnam (1967)
sources.description: "Far from Vietnam" is a 1967 documentary that features contributions from several renowned directors, including Jean-Luc Godard and Chris Marker. The film is divided into segments that express solidarity with the North Vietnamese during the Vietnam War, showcasing both documentary footage from Vietnam and anti-war demonstrations in the United States, while also reflecting on the moral implications of the conflict.

metadata.Plot: In seven different segments, Godard, Klein, Lelouch, Marker, Resnais, and Varda show their sympathy and support for the North Vietnamese army during the Vietnam War.
metadata.Director: Jean-Luc Godard, Joris Ivens, William Klein
metadata.Writer: Jean-Luc Godard, Jean Lacouture, Chris Marker
metadata.Actors: Anne Bellec, Karen Blanguernon, Fidel Castro
